body:
Hello, can you see any error in the console output? Have you successfully
tried the XPath with another tool on the dame XML? Do you have namespaces
that need to be aliased in the config? What is the default namespace?
On Feb 26, 2013 10:41 PM, "Dave Whalen" notifications@github.com wrote:

> I am trying to extract a value using xpath. I want to put it into a
> variable that I can use later. My let is returning a blank (see atch). I've
> tried a couple of options but I get nothing. I've also tried putting it in
> the GET - that gives me a yellow java error. Suggestions?
> 
> [image: Xpath2]https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3673410/198754/029905fe-8065-11e2-8d3a-d7d815444175.png
> [image: Xpath1]https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3673410/198755/02957510-8065-11e2-8594-5af7ecc8978e.png
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/issues/53
> .

Actually I see that you have a namespace... Check the documentation. You
need to define

restfixture.xml.namespace.context

In RestFixtureConfig and use the alias defined in your XPath

If the alias is myns:http://namespace

The XPath is like

//myns:path/myns:yourelement/text()

Hello????

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on
GitHubhttps://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/issues/53#issuecomment-14636129
.

http://smartrics.blogspot.co.uk/2011/01/restfixture-with-namespaces-support.html
On Mar 8, 2013 6:40 PM, "Dave Whalen" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hello????
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/issues/53#issuecomment-14636129
> .

looking at your xml above please try the following:

this is the namespace your xml is defined within:

`!define defns {!-/pcat/1/catalog/order/v3_0-!}`

tip to avoid having to type the fully qualified name in each Table fixture

```
| Import |
| smartrics.rest.fitnesse.fixture |
```

define the namespace in the config table (this typically goes in the SuiteSetUp

```
| Table: Rest Fixture Config |
| restfixture.xml.namespace.context | ns=${defns} |
```

Now your XPath should use the ns alias defined above:

```
|Table: Rest Fixture|
| GET | .... |
| let | proposalNumber | body | //ns:proposalNumber/text() | |
```

please let me know if it works.

```
```

Will do...thanks!!!

I can reproduce the issue.

the XML received is 
`<order xmlns="/pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0">...`

which implies that the elements rooted under element order are in the namespace /pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0.
but that doesn't match with your definition

```
!define defns {!-http://oews-dev4.l3.com/pcat/1/catalog/order/v3_0-!}

|!-Table:smartrics.rest.fitnesse.fixture.RestFixtureConfig-!|
| restfixture.xml.namespace.context | ns=${defns} |
```

besides the XPath engine that RestFixture uses (the JDK embedded jaxp implementation) does not cope with relative URI namespace declarations, so even if you define 

```
!define defns {!-/pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0-!}

|!-Table:smartrics.rest.fitnesse.fixture.RestFixtureConfig-!|
| restfixture.xml.namespace.context | ns=${defns} |
```

will not work.

to pass the test you should receive from the server something like

`<order xmlns="http://oews-dev4.l3.com/pcat/1/catalog/order/v3_0">...`

I've tried a few things.  Nothing works and the results are different.
1.  I fixed the typo in the define for the ns.  Green, but no text value.
2.  Changed the define to use the URI:  !define defns
   {!-pcat/1/catalog/order/v3_0-!}.  Green, but no text value
3.  Tried the fully qualified ns: !define defns {!-
   http://oews-dev4.l3.com/pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0-!}.  Green, but no text
   value - also tried v5_0 with the same result.
4.  Tried defns {!-pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0-!} Because the XML response
   contains v5_0 as the XSD version.  Green but no text value.
5.  Put the XPath in the GET as follows:
   
   | GET |http://oews-dev4.l3.com/oe-platform-app/Order/Order/Master/1006LYYQ|20\d
   ||//ns:proposalNumber/text()|

Result:  Red:

//ns:proposalNumber/text()
_expected_
*
*
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><order
xmlns="/pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0"><orderIdentifier><orderSchema>/pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0</orderSchema><orderNumber>1006LYYQ</orderNumber><orderVersion>0</orderVersion><orderURL>/oe-platform-app/Order/Order/Published/1006LYYQ?version=1</orderURL><rootOrderNumber>1006LYYQ</rootOrderNumber></orderIdentifier><detail><general><proposalNumber>8619</proposalNumber><orderStatus>In
Progress</orderStatus><orderVersionStatus>Master</orderVersionStatus><orderType>Install</orderType><orderCategory>Customer</orderCategory><createDate>2013-03-21T20:17:30.987Z</createDate><createBy>l3svc.oePlatform</createBy><sourceSystem>WFOE</sourceSystem><opptyID>313841</opptyID><DiscountedMRC>3963.0146</DiscountedMRC><AmortizedNRC>4000.0000</AmortizedNRC><totalNrc>4000.0000</totalNrc><orderDate><customerSignedDate>2013-03-18T00:00:00</customerSignedDate></orderDate></general><customer><customerNumber>1-T8BD</customerNumber><customerName>Sunday
UAT</customerName></customer><billingAccount><billingAccountNumber>1-T8BD</billingAccountNumber></billingAccount></detail></order>
_actual_
*
*
not found: '//ns:proposalNumber/text()'

Next?

Thank you so much for your help!!!  Once we get this riddle solved, I'll
need to do the same thing using JSON.

Also - I'm wondering if I may not have the REST fixture installed
correctly.  I don't have the folder hierarchy from the zip file.  A
developer recommended that I put all of the jar files in a single folder
and delete the sub-folders.  I originally had trouble with fitnesse finding
the REST fixture.  Moving the jars seemed to fix that.

This is what my root looks like:
classpath:
C:\fitnesse\RestFixture\smartrics-RestFixture-3.0-bin\smartrics-RestFixture-3.0\lib\smartrics-RestFixture-3.0.jar
classpath:
C:\fitnesse\RestFixture\smartrics-RestFixture-3.0-bin\smartrics-RestFixture-3.0\lib*.jar

Thanks again!!!
Dave

> .

I believe the problem is in the server. The xml returned by the server has
the order tag with xmlns not supported.

Can you make the server return an xml containing

<order xmlns="http://pcat/1/catalog/order/v5_0 " ...

(note the missing http://) ??

Hi,
Could you please help in validating the XML,

I am facing the problem with assertions.

1.  Below is the sample excerpt from the XML

```
<Order xmlns="http://namespace.abc.defghi.com/common/v2_4_1/order" version="2.4.1" type="TEST" ID="123456789">
<Header>
<SourceService>
<Application>
<Name>xxxx</Name>
<Version>2.0</Version>
</Application>
<Locale country="US" language="en"/>
</SourceService>
</Header>
```

I want to validate Version from the above xml. can you please help ?

Below is the test

!define defns {!-http://namespace.abc.defghi.com/common/v2_4_1/order-!}

|Table: Rest Fixture Config                   |
|restfixture.xml.namespace.context|ns=${defns}|

and assertion as
//Order/Header/SourceService/Application/Version[text()='2.0']

2. Also Can you help with the namespaces as below
```
OrderSubmit xmlns="FES.DigitalIntegrationServices">
<AppKey>acbd-efgh-thyj-ok4y</AppKey>
<OrderManifest>
<OrderID>1234567</OrderID>
<OriginatorOrderID>1234567</OriginatorOrderID>
<Summary>
<TotalTax>0.0</TotalTax>
<TotalPrice>16.99</TotalPrice>
<TotalItemPrice>16.99</TotalItemPrice>
<TotalShipping>0.0</TotalShipping>
<TotalHandling>0.0</TotalHandling>
<OwnerInfo>
```
I want to write an assertion for validating OrderID

Hi this worked for me

    |Table: Rest Fixture Config | conf |
    |restfixture.xml.namespace.context| !-defns=http://namespace.abc.defghi.com/common/v2_4_1/order-! |

    |Table: Rest Fixture |http://${jettyHost}:${jettyPort} | conf |
    | GET | /order |  |  | //defns:Version[text()='2.0'] |
